feels.name: Interest
feels.quote: Dorothea was quite grateful to Lydgate for telling her about the New Hospital and expressed her willingness to help.
feels.exactPlace: Walking round the laurel-planted plots of the New Hospital

feels.name: Melancholy
feels.quote: Dorothea felt a melancholy cadence in her voice as she spoke about the trouble taken in the world.
feels.exactPlace: At home discussing the trouble taken in the world

feels.name: Perturbed
feels.quote: Mr. Mawmsey's views were perturbed after his conversation with Lydgate about the New Hospital.

feels.name: Indignation
feels.quote: Mrs. Mawmsey expressed indignation at the opposition to the New Hospital.
feels.exactPlace: In the drawing-room over the shop

feels.name: Satisfaction
feels.quote: Mrs. Mawmsey had done this with satisfaction, including it among his responsibilities as a husband and father.
feels.exactPlace: In the drawing-room over the shop

feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: Mr. Gambit lifted his eyebrows with cautious surprise upon hearing Lydgate's views on medicine.
feels.exactPlace: Upon hearing about Lydgate's views on medicine
